section.title: Pending Records
section.para: This action and its sub-menu items enables a bank user acting on behalf of the Advising Bank, to respond to and address transactions submitted by the banks clients. The pending records displayed are the transaction events that have been submitted to the bank by its clients. They are now waiting for an acknowledgement by the bank's Trade Services, which has to decide if the related requests can be approved and hence processed in the back-office operations of the bank. Pending Records

Until a pending record has been approved by the bank through this option, the record is not seen by the client as Existing (if it is a creation of a transaction), Amended or Updated. In other words, its new or updated details have not been committed to the master of this transaction record as long as the acknowledgement has not been applied.

section.title: Pending Records - Process flow
section.para: The mechanism of generation of the reply and the associated work flow for the bank user is the following:

listitem.para: Review the list of pending records, either from the home page or from the consolidated list.
Select a record by clicking on its assigned reference number () to see more details than the summary appearing in the list.
An input form is displayed with the following capabilities:

The details of the event of the event can be viewed as well as the full details of the transaction itself. These details can be printed or exports as a PDF format. The form can be put aside for now and returned to later, if some processing / validation is required in the back-office before an acknowledgement message can be created.

After reviewing the details, and after the back-office has processed the request, The first part of the reporting form can be used to enter the text details of the message that will be sent as an acknowledgement to the customer together with any attachments.

note.para: If the details of the transaction record need to be altered as a consequence of the processing by the back office (for instance if some modifications have been provided by the user by phone), it is advisable to convey these changes in a subsequent reporting message (sent from the Existing Records menu item). This will keep the consistency between the data of the back-office and the file that will be displayed to the customer as part of his reporting. And since it is an additional reporting message, the customer still has access, via the transaction history, to the original details as well as the updated details.

section.title: Pending Records - List Of records
section.para:
Display a list of pending records. Pending Records
List

listitem.para: Since these transactional messages are among the most urgent things for a bank user to consider in order to provide the customer with a fast response to business requests, the home page shows a list of the most recently received transactions, under the heading Recent Applications. To avoid a too long a display, the list is limited by default to 10 items. This number can be changed via a properties file. Click an entry in the list to rapidly open the reporting form and show its full details.

section.para: When this option is selected, a list is displayed of requests from clients that have not yet been addressed. Once any user at the bank has started to work on a pending record and has either saved it or tried a submission, that record will not appear in this list but instead in the list displayed by the Edit Transactions or Retrieve Unsigned sub-menu item.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are the , Company (that sent the request), and/or Product fields. (The product can be any of those that enable a client to send a request to the bank.)

There is also a
button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: CSV downloads the list to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the list to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools). When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingEL.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.
The columns returned in the list of Pending Records are the following:

entry.para: Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated by the client.
Abbreviated name of the client company that sent the transaction.
Type of the transaction. Possible values are:

listitem.para: New (for an initiation, such as the creation of new Letter of Credit issuance, a new Shipping Guarantee, Financing Request, Banker's Guarantee, Fund Transfer, Export Collection instruction, Inward Remittance)
Amend (for an amendment to an Import Letter of Credit (Commercial or Standby) or Banker's Guarantee, whether Inc for increase, Dec for decrease or Terms)
Message (for a free format / update message on any of the products)

entry.para: For a creation of a new file, this shows the total amount. For an amendment to an Import Letter of Credit or Banker's Guarantee whereby an increase or decrease of amount has been entered by the customer, the difference in amount is shown. In all other cases, including the free format / update messages of all products, nothing is displayed in the column since no amount is directly tied to the transaction event.

Date the transaction was sent from the customer site. In order to avoid consistency issues between the various time zones of the bank and its customers (and even within a given customer company), this release date is set according to the time zone of the server.

section.para: Selecting the by double clicking on it, will allow report to be performed against that transaction. For further details see the chapter on Reporting from Pending Records Form.

section.title: Pending Record Form - Transaction details
section.para:
This section of the form summarises the key information of the transaction. For all products, it contains the following fields:
Field
Type
Description
Full Details
(
Icon at the right-hand end of the General Details title line.) Open a pop up window to show the full details of the current transaction. The content of this pop up window is specific to each product. It contains two sections:
The first shows the details specific to the current transaction event and could for instance typically include any additional details or file uploaded by the customer when creating a Message.
The second shows the current complete master details of the transaction record.
Company Name
Abbreviated name of the company that sent the transaction.
Product Code
Type of product that the transaction relates to, either Import Letter of Credit, Shipping Guarantee or Financing Request.
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated by the client.
Transaction Id
Unique reference number generated by for this event associated with this transaction. This field is only displayed if the transaction has been actioned previously by the Bank
Bank Reference
Reference assigned by your bank's back office to this transaction. Maximum 20 alphanumeric characters. This field is only displayed if the transaction has been actioned previously by the Bank
Transaction Type
Type of transaction. Possible values are:
New (for an initiation, such as the creation of new Letter of Credit issuance, a new Shipping Guarantee, Financing Request, Banker's Guarantee, Fund Transfer, Export Collection instruction, Inward Remittance)
Amend (for an amendment to an Import Letter of Credit (Commercial or Standby) or Banker's Guarantee, whether Inc for increase, Dec for decrease or Terms)
Message (for a free format / update message on any of the products)
Release Date/Time
Date the transaction was sent from the customer site. In order to avoid consistency issues between the various time zones of the bank and its customers (and even within a given customer company), this release date is set according to the time zone of the server.
Issue Date
(
)
Issue date of the transaction. You must enter this when you approve the request. Needed only for LC, SI, SG and BG, and only when the Recipient Bank is also the Issuing Bank.
When applicable the date entered must be a valid date and will be checked against the Expiry Date, if any. The field can be left empty if the bank does not accept the client's initiation.
Amendment Number
(
)
Default amendment number. You must set this for an LC or BG amendment, The only constraint imposed by the system is for the field to be a valid number between 0 and 999. This field is only displayed if the Transaction Type is 'amend'.
Amendment Date
(
)
Also in the case of an LC or BG amendment, the date specified by the client can be adjusted by the bank officer in the bank's acknowledgement. The system checks that the date is well-formed and after the issue date, if any (LC only).This field is only displayed if the Transaction Type is 'amend'.

section.title: Pending Record Form - Reporting Message details
section.para:
This section contains the following input fields for the reporting message and status adjustments to be applied to the transaction. It allows the transaction status to be changed and a message sent to the original creator of the transaction. The Reporting Message details fields are described as follows:
Field
Type
Description
New Transaction Status
Set this from the dropdown list to Approved to indicate to the client that the request has been approved by the bank or Rejected to indicate it has been rejected.
For Financing Requests, there is an additional value Provisional in the dropdown and it is the default value if your customer has marked the transaction as Provisional while creating it. During the course of the discussions with the customer regarding the transaction, you can keep the status as Provisional till an agreement is reached and request the customer for the desired action from the Action Required dropdown. However, once the terms are acceptable, you can change the status to Approved, and if it is not acceptable, you can change it to Rejected.
Bank Reference
(
)
This field is only available when the transaction event is a creation of a new file. Reference assigned by your bank's back office to this transaction. Maximum 20 alphanumeric characters.
If the transaction is rejected, type any string that would reasonably be interpreted as a non-reference by the customer (for example, the word None).
Attach a Cover Letter
(
)
Tick here if a cover letter is required. This field is present only for Direct EC.
Comment
Any explanation or details you need to give to indicate the characteristics of the completion of the reporting. Maximum of 30 lines of 65 characters. For example, for an approved transaction, you could provide a generic message of acknowledgment followed by the list of charges and commissions collected under the transaction. For a rejection, enter some text to explain the reason for refusal.
Click the list
icon to the right of the field, to select from a list of common phrases.
Action Required
Indicate what you want the client to do in their reply to this message. Select from the drop down list: Customer Instructions, Discrepancy Response, Consent Response, Amendment Response.

section.title: Pending Record Form - File Upload details

Clicking the Add a File button in this section of the form. Allows files to be uploaded an attached to this transaction (Max 5 files and 1 Mb each). It contains the following fields:

section.title: Pending Record Form - Edit/Hide Transaction Details
section.para: Note that if you are replying to a transactional message, you can also edit the complete details of the current record. In such a case, no client instruction can be overridden since he can only use a free format input field, and there is therefore no risk for the bank to alter the transaction details as part of the same transaction event. This feature is explained further in the section Product-Specific Forms later in this Guide.

section.title: Pending Record Form - Action Buttons
section.para: The operations that you can perform from the Pending Records pages are listed below. They appear at the top of each relevant web page. For each of them, a pop up window asks you to confirm your choice.

entry.para: Save the transaction details (including the status, possible back-office reference, comment, and all the optional modifications of the transaction details) as a draft. The message remains as a pending record without being sent to the client for now. No validation of the mandatory fields is performed at this stage.
Send the message to the client. Do this when all the requested (and mandatory) transaction details have been entered and the resulting record is ready for submission.

Depending on your jurisdiction profile (in particular, the amount you are authorised to validate without an additional signature), the amendment is either sent to the client or remains in the bank workspace as unsigned.
Leave the current page and return to the main menu.
Open a pop up window displaying the online help pages.

section.title: Pending Records - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para:
This option is used to complete a Reporting Message that a bank user has already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised bank user. Retrieve
Unsigned Pending Records
Pending Records
Retrieve Unsigned
Retrieve Unsigned
Pending Records

When this option is selected, a list is displayed of Reporting Messages that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. If sufficient authorisations are allocated in the profile of the authorising user, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which must be ticked to select it. A Submit button at the end of the page, submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is re-displayed.
